summary.p: 105 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: B. 3; Text: Q 6:21-125; 4 lines per page; Dimensions: 165 x 105 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 3rd (9th) century [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 17: "47 B. 3 An‘am [Enam] suresinden bir bölüm Parşömen. 105mm boy ve 165mm eninde 105 yaprak. Sahifede kûfî yazı ile 115mm uzunl.[uğunda] 4 satır. Tahminen III. (IX) asırda yazılmış. Y. 1b ve Y. 2a ya sonradan Basmala ve Fātiḥā yazılmıştır. Miklepli kahve rengi deri ve ebru cilt. Kenarlarını kurt yemiştir. Bu ciltte Anʿam (6) suresinin 21. ayetinden aynı surenin 125. ayetinin sonuna kadar vardır."

This can be translated as follows: "47 B. 3 A part of the Sūra al-ʾAnʿām Parchment. 105 junk shaped leaves of 105 mm height and 165 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 4 lines measuring 115 mm. Probably copied during the 3rd (9th) century. Basmala and Fātiḥā were added later onto the L. 1b and L. 2a. Brown leather binding with flap (miklep) and marbling (ebru). The corners are worm-eaten. The fragment begins with Q 6:21 (Sūra al-ʾAnʿām) and continues until the end of Q 6:125."
